name: gouging
content:
gouging noun
(CHARGING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] US informal the action of charging someone too much money for something, in a way that is dishonest or unfair: price gouging He has received complaints about price gouging, with some vets charging $50 per dose. The chairman of the Senate Banking Committee accused the banks of gouging.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a $1,000 penalty for price gouging under Florida law.The commission voted to extend price caps on wholesale power in an attempt to shield consumers from possible price gouging.Is there any other industry in the world that would tolerate this gouging of customers?

gouging noun
(EYE)
[ C or U ] the action of pushing or cutting into something in a rough or violent way, especially pressing roughly into someone's eyes: eye gouging This was a vicious type of street fighting in which only biting and eye gouging were forbidden.
More examplesFewer examplesThe player received a 13-week ban for gouging.The film contained violent scenes including murders and eye gougings.
